result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry T Taper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terry T Taper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Terry T Taper was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge from bail on deposit.  Remaining bail to be returned to whoever posted it.
CASH BOND APPLIED

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work release.  Defendant to report by 09/25/2015.  Court has no objection to electronic monitoring.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry T Taper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terry T Taper in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab  
Count 1:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work release.  Defendant to report by 09/25/2015.  Court has no objection to electronic monitoring.
  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge from bail on deposit.  Remaining bail to be returned to whoever posted it.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Terry T Taper in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case is in court for a jury trial.
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, count 1 is amended to Disorderly Conduct, pursuant to Wisc. stat. 947.01. and dismissed the penalty enhancer, Domestic Abuse.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
As to count 1 as amended:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 2:
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 dismissed.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
Sentencing scheduled for 09/18/2015 at 08:30 a.m.

Defendant Terry T Taper in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
cab
 Final pretrial conference held.  Defendant rejects State's offer. Court informs parties all offers are off the table.  Case remains calendared on 09/02/2015 at 08:30 a.m.
for jury trial in Branch 36.
Received and filed:
Motions in Limine.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions.

Defendant Terry T Taper in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial in branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. 
Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jeanette M. or Mario C.

Defendant Terry T Taper in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   


Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant DOES NOT WANT Public Defender services, but may be public defender eligible.  Defendant informed the Court he will refer to public defender's office. The case is adjourned to Br. 23 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM029359  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/13/2015
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
